post_text:
Welcome Ms. Jensen - MS Math Teacher!

Originally from the Chicago area, I grew up with one younger brother, Cody, and will forever be a Chicago sports fan. Go Bulls!!
When I was younger, I was a gymnast for 12 years and played soccer for 8 years. I eventually got into coaching gymnastics and developed a passion for helping kids learn. I still hope to open my own gym one day!! I moved to Arizona in 2002 to attend ASU and graduated in 2006 with a BA in Elementary Education. I later received my certification to teach both at the high school level and adults. I have been teaching for 13 years and am thrilled to be returning to Dobson Academy! In my free time I enjoy reading, playing with my two puppies, Remi and Zoe, and laying by the pool. I look forward to starting an exciting year and meeting all of my new students!!

Welcome Mr. John DeDonato - MS ELA Teacher

After having a career in Sales and Finance, I was able to return to a dormant, but not forgotten, dream of teaching. This will be my second year teaching Language Arts to middle school students. I hold a Bachelor of Science Degree in Human Development from Warner Pacific College, in Portland Oregon, as well as a Master of Arts in Teaching Degree from George Fox University, located in Newberg, Oregon. Both of my children attended Dobson Academy, so I am excited about joining staff this year, as we all have fond memories of the school. In my free time, I enjoy traveling, hiking, and spending time with my family.
